intro: Astracantha esfandiarii, commonly known as the Persian milkweed, is a perennial herb native to the arid regions of Iran. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a distinctive yellow corona. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
